definition: peptide (two or more amino acids linked by peptide bonds CO-NH)

sentences.english: You need also the health endorphin to open the artery to the next level.
sentences.chinese: 您還需要健康內啡肽切開動脈，以一個新的水平。

sentences.english: These are the endorphins working to alleviate the body of as much stress as possible.
sentences.chinese: 極有可能是內啡肽的作用降低了身體的緊張感。

sentences.english: Endorphines and enkephalins are names given to these neurotransmitters.
sentences.chinese: 內啡肽和腦啡肽類便是這類神經遞質的名字。

sentences.english: Endorphins serve as powerful pain relievers.
sentences.chinese: 內啡肽可以作爲強效止痛藥。

sentences.english: Endorphins, for example, are still providing a sense of well-being and security.
sentences.chinese: 比如內啡肽，仍然向我們提供着一種幸福感和安全感。

sentences.english: Endorphines in turn are neurotransmitters that are chemically similar to morphine.1
sentences.chinese: 內啡肽在化學上類似嗎啡，是一種神經遞質。

sentences.english: This may be endorphin and Met-enkephalin and the fight against cancer, one of the mechanisms.
sentences.chinese: 這可能是內啡肽和甲硫啡肽與癌症鬥爭的機制之一。

sentences.english: This is why endorphins are commonly associated with runner's high.
sentences.chinese: 這也是“奔跑的愉悅”總與內啡肽聯繫在遺棄的原因。
